config.question: Which of the following demonstrates, in chronological order, the types of play that children engage in as they grow older?

choices.content: Cooperative play, associative play, parallel play
Parallel play, cooperative play, associative play
Parallel play, associative play, cooperative play
Cooperative play, parallel play, associative play

answer_2.response: Consider this: Young preschoolers begin by playing side by side with similar toys without interacting with one another (parallel play). As they get older, they begin to interact by sharing or borrowing toys without doing the same thing (associative play). Finally, they begin to play together, taking turns, playing games, or devising contests (cooperative play). LO 4.13 In what sorts of social relationships and play do preschool-age children engage?
